content.en: Birthdays are great! I can't wait until my birthday, when I will turn one year older. My birthday is in August. What month is your birthday? On that special day, you can add one year to your age.
content.tw: 每過一次生日，我們又大一歲了！我的生日在八月，你的呢？

content.en: Actually, there's one place where everybody gets older on the same day. That place is South Korea. How can this be? In South Korea, there is an old way to count a person's age. On January 1st, every person adds one year to their age.
content.tw: 在南韓傳統中，每個人在新年那天都會長一歲！

content.en: That means no matter what day their birthday is, they get one year older on New Year's Day.
content.tw: 所以不管他們生日在甚麼時候，每過一次新年就會大一歲。

content.en: Many South Koreans don't like this old way. For one thing, it's hard for the rest of the world to understand. South Koreans don't want to spend too much time explaining their age.
content.tw: 很多南韓人不喜歡他們的計算方式，而且因為其他國家的人不太懂，很多南韓人不想花太多時間解釋。

content.en: What's more, the old way makes South Koreans feel too old. They want to get older on their own birthday, not on New Year's Day. After all, everybody loves to celebrate their special birthday!
content.tw: 而且這樣感覺比較老！他們想要到自己生日那天才長一歲，而不是新年的那一天。這樣才可以慶祝生日！

content.en: Starting this year, the old way will change. From now on, South Koreans will get older on their birthday, just like the rest of the world. Plus, this new way will make everybody feel a little younger.
content.tw: 從今年開始，舊的計歲方式將會改變。從現在起，南韓人將會在他們的生日那天變老，就像世界其他地方的人一樣。此外，這個新方式將會讓大家感覺年輕一點。

vocabulary.preface: 南韓人傳統上一過新年就長一歲，但是他們現在改成過完生日才增加一歲。

content.text:
1. old 老的
My birthday is next week. 我下星期生日。
And you'll still be 25. 而你仍然是25歲。
Yes, I'll stay 25 years old for 10 years. 對，未來十年我都是25歲。

2. count 數數目
I'd say you can't count. 我說你不會數數目。
I'm perfectly able to count. 我完全會數數目。
I just don't want to get older. 我只是不想變老。

3. younger 比較年輕的
You are getting older whether you want to or not. 你會變老，不管你想不想。
I know that! I also know that I'm not getting any younger.
我知道，我也知道我不會變年輕。

4. age 年齡
Then why do you want to stay at the age of 25? 那你為什麼要停留在25歲？
So that I can remain young at heart. 這樣我才能保持內心年輕。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些是很常用的單字。
old 老的
count 數數目
younger 比較年輕的
age 年齡

quiz.question: 1. What happens on your birthday?
2. In the past, when did South Koreans get older?
3. How did the old way make South Koreans feel?

content.en: Do you sometimes not feel like taking a shower? Wouldn't it be nice if there was some kind of machine that could clean your body?
content.tw: 你會不會有時候懶得洗澡呢？如果這時候有機器可以幫你洗澡，該有多好！

content.en: Imagine this: You get into a machine that looks like a big bathtub. You turn it on, sit back and relax, and 15 minutes later, you're done. Oh, and the machine also dries your hair and your body.
content.tw: 想像你有一個像大浴缸的機器，啟動它、坐下去，然後好好地放鬆。15分鐘後，就洗好了！機器還會幫你弄乾身體跟頭髮。

content.en: You don't have to do anything! Doesn't that sound amazing? Well, here's the best part: it's real! A company in Japan is making washing machines for humans!
content.tw: 這個機器真的存在！日本有一家公司已經推出洗澡機！

content.en: It's going to be really high-tech! The human washing machine will have a super smart computer that knows how to heat water, so it's not too hot and not too cold…just perfect for you.
content.tw: 這個洗澡機很高科技，它有一個超級聰明的電腦，會把水加熱到不太冷也不太熱的溫度--對你來講就會剛剛好的溫度！

content.en: The company wants you to feel calm and relaxed when you are in the human washing machine, so it plays music while it cleans you!
content.tw: 這家公司希望你洗澡的時候可以放鬆，所以這台機器還會邊洗邊放音樂。

content.en: What do you think? Would you like a bath in a human washing machine?
content.tw: 你覺得呢？你想在人類洗澡機裡洗澡嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 想洗個澡嗎? 現在也有幫人洗澡的機器囉。

content.text: 1. machine 機器。 I'm so tired today. 我今天好累。 If only I had a washing machine to wash me! 要是有機器來給我洗澡就好了! There is such a machine, you know. 是有這種機器。
2. wash 洗。 So I just step in the bathtub and do nothing? 所以我只要踏進澡盆，什麼都不用做? Yeah, the machine can even wash your hair. 沒錯，機器甚至可以幫你洗頭髮。
3. dry 吹乾。 And then it will dry your hair and body. 然後它會吹乾你的頭髮和身體。 Will it put on my pajamas for me? 它會幫我穿上睡衣嗎? You're asking too much, Paz! 你要求太多了!
4. perfect 完美的。 No, I just want a perfect machine. 不，我只是想要個完美的機器。 All I need to do is lie down and sleep. 我就只需要躺下來睡覺。

vocabulary.postscript: 你想買個洗澡機器嗎? 來讀讀單字。 machine機器 wash洗 dry吹乾 perfect完美的

quiz.question: 1. Where is the human washing machine company based?
2. How long will the machine take to wash a human?
3. What does the human washing machine look like?

content.en: A river is very strong. It takes water from the mountains to the ocean, and it's always pushing forward. A river is full of power!
content.tw: 河流的力量很強，可以把水從山上一路帶到海裡。

content.en: How can people use that power? On many rivers, people build a dam. A dam is a wall across the river. The dam can hold back the water, and use the river's power to make electricity for people.
content.tw: 人們會在河川上蓋水壩，把水攔住，用河流的力量發電。

content.en: More dams make more power, and more electricity for us to use. That sounds good... but actually, people have decided to remove the dams from a river in California.
content.tw: 越多水壩，就有越多電，聽起來不錯吧？但最近，加州的人決定把他們一條河上的水壩都拆掉。

content.en: That's because people are not the only ones who use the river. Fish also need to live there.
content.tw: 因為不只是人類需要河流，魚類也需要生活空間。

content.en: For the salmon, the river is like a road. Every year, the salmon swim up the river to lay their eggs.
content.tw: 對鮭魚來說，河流就像一條路。鮭魚每一年都會逆流而上去產卵。

content.en: When the eggs hatch, the baby salmon swim back down the river to reach the ocean. It's the circle of life.
content.tw: 卵孵化之後，鮭魚寶寶會順流而下游回大海。

content.en: But those fish can't swim up and down the river if there is a dam! To help the salmon live, people in California will take the dams away.
content.tw: 但如果有水壩擋路，那些魚就不能在河裡游上游下，所以人們決定把水壩拆掉。

content.en: Even though dams are useful, they also harm the environment. Let's respect the fish and take those dams down!
content.tw: 儘管水壩很有用，它們也會傷害環境。讓我們尊重魚類，並把那些水壩拆除吧！

vocabulary.preface: 移除水壩，救了鮭魚，而人類最好節約用電。

content.text:
1. lay eggs 產卵
My goldfish has laid many eggs! 我的金魚生了好多蛋！
Come take a look. 你來看看。
Wow, how wonderful! 哇，好神奇！

2. hatch 孵化
What are you going to do with them? 你要拿這些蛋怎麼辦？
I'll just let them hatch. 就讓它們孵化。
No, you can't do that. The other goldfish will quickly eat them.

3. decide 決定
You need to decide if you want to see baby goldfish.
你得決定是不是想看到金魚寶寶。
And if I do? 要是我想呢？
Then you must take away the other fish.

4. live 居住
They can live in your bathtub for a while. 它們可以在你的澡盆裡住一陣子。
What? No! 什麼啊，我才不要！
You have a fish tank, right? 你有水族箱，對吧？

vocabulary.postscript:
今天學到哪些單字？
lay eggs 產卵
hatch 孵化
decide 決定
live 居住

quiz.question: 1. What is a dam?
2. Why are people removing dams?
options: a. To build even bigger dams

quiz.question: 3. Where are people removing dams?

content.en: Do you like to play with plastic bricks? They are fun toys we can use to build things. You can use plastic bricks to build cars, houses, even castles and spaceships.
content.tw: 你喜歡玩塑膠積木嗎？我們可以用它蓋很多東西，像是汽車、房屋、城堡，甚至是太空船。

content.en: Now, a man named David is using these toys to build arms.
content.tw: 現在，一個名叫 David 的男生用塑膠積木做了一條手臂！

content.en: When David was born, his right arm was much smaller than his left arm. At school, other kids would bully him about his smaller arm. Their words made him feel bad!
content.tw: David 出生的時候，右邊的手臂比左邊的小很多。他在學校常常被霸凌，讓他很難過。

content.en: David's parents wanted to buy him a fake arm, but they were too expensive.
content.tw: 他的爸爸媽媽想要幫他買義肢，可是太貴了。

content.en: At home, he loved to play with plastic bricks. One day, he had an idea. Could he use these toys to build an arm?
content.tw: David 喜歡玩塑膠積木。有一天他好奇，塑膠積木能不能做一條手臂？

content.en: First, David built a simple arm. It looked cool, but he knew he could do better. So he built another arm, with fingers that could grab things. His new arm was useful!
content.tw: 他一開始做出一條簡單的手臂，後來又做了一個，這一次可以用手指抓住東西。

content.en: People were surprised David used toys to build such a great arm. What's more, his new arm was not expensive.
content.tw: David 的新手臂讓大家都很驚訝。而且新手臂不貴。

content.en: David wants to help people like him. So now he builds arms for other people too! And they're not expensive. All thanks to a few tiny plastic bricks!
content.tw: 大衛想幫助像他一樣的人。所以現在他也為其他人建造手臂！而且它們不貴。這一切都歸功於一些小小的塑膠積木！

vocabulary.preface: 聰明的大衛利用玩具來改善他的狀況，還可以幫助別人！

content.text:
1. build 建造
You built a castle with Lego bricks! 你用樂高積木做了古堡!
Don't you know I'm good at building things? 你不知道我很會建造東西嗎?

2. spaceship 太空船
I know you're good, but this is really something.
我知道你很會，但是這真的不簡單。
I can even build you a spaceship if you want.
假如你要，我甚至可以做一艘太空船給你。

3. house 房屋
I'd prefer a small house. 我更想要一棟小屋。
A house? Wow! 一棟房子? 哇！
Yes, with two bedrooms. 對，要有兩個房間。

4. plastic 塑膠的
So you plan to live in it? 所以你打算住在裡面？
No, I plan to have my two dogs live there. 不，我打算讓我的兩隻狗狗住。
Okay, a plastic brick dog house. 一棟塑膠積木狗屋。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like building things?
build 建造
spaceship 太空船
house 房屋
plastic 塑膠的

quiz.question: 1. Why didn't David's parents buy a fake arm?
2. What did David use to make an arm?
3. How did people feel about David's new arm?

content.en: Ah! The violin. So beautiful, so peaceful, so… expensive!
content.tw: 小提琴聲音好好聽，可是好貴！

content.en: The most expensive violin ever made cost 20 million U.S. dollars, that's nearly 615 million NT dollars! A new violin for a beginner costs about 15,000 NT. But that's still a lot of money!
content.tw: 世界最貴的小提琴要兩千萬美金，將近六億一千五百萬台幣！初學者的小提琴大概一萬五千元台幣，但這樣還是很貴！

content.en: Do you know what that is? That's the sound of a 3D printer.
content.tw: 這個聲音是 3D 印表機。

content.en: They're so cool, they can make anything you like! Toys, tables, tennis rackets… you name it!
content.tw: 可以做出任何你想要的東西，像是玩具、桌子、網球拍都可以！

content.en: You type in what you want, and the 3D printer gets to work, shooting liquid plastic into the air! The plastic goes hard really fast, which means it can make lots of different shapes and sizes.
content.tw: 只要輸入想要的東西，3D印表機就會噴出液態塑膠，很快就會乾囉。這代表我們可以做出各種形狀、大小的東西！

content.en: Some clever musicians in America are now using 3D printers to make violins, so they're much cheaper!
content.tw: 美國有一些音樂家已經在用3D列印機製造小提琴，這樣便宜多了！

content.en: Other instruments have been 3D printed before too, like guitars and saxophones!
content.tw: 以前也有人用3D列印機做出吉他跟薩克斯風。

content.en: What instrument would you like to print and play?
content.tw: 你想要列印和演奏什麼樂器？

vocabulary.preface: 3D印表機可以做出小提琴，而且聲音還跟真正的小提琴一樣！

content.text:
1. play 彈奏
I've never learned to play the guitar. 我從來沒學過彈吉他。
But you play so well! 你卻彈得這麼好！
Thank you. I'm still a beginner. 謝謝你，我還是初學者。
I taught myself how to play last year. 我去年才教我自己怎麼彈。

2. cost 花費
Maybe you should take a class. 也許你該去上個課。
No, that would cost too much. 不了，那花太多錢了。

3. clever 聰明的
How about letting me help you? 讓我幫你忙如何？
What, for guitar lessons? 什麼忙，上吉他課嗎？
Yeah, you're clever. You can learn it fast. 對啊，你很聰明的，可以學很快。

4. guitar 吉他
Then can I have a new guitar? 那我可以有一把新吉他嗎？
Not worried about the cost now? 現在你就不擔心花費了？

vocabulary.postscript:
These are useful words to learn.
play 彈奏
cost 花費
clever 聰明的
guitar 吉他

quiz.question: 1. How much is 20 million U.S. dollars in NT dollars?
2. What does a 3D printer shoot into the air?
3. What other instrument has been 3D printed before?

content.en: Last month in America an airline flight was cancelled.
content.tw: 上個月美國有一架班機被取消，不能飛。

content.en: Everyone thought they were going to be late! Until one very clever traveler, called Renee, had a very clever idea…
content.tw: 大家都以為他們將會晚到目的地，但名叫 Renee 的旅客想了一個好點子。

content.en: Instead of flying, Renee thought she and her daughter could drive home!
content.tw: Renee 覺得她跟她女兒可以開車回家！

content.en: Just then, Renee had another very clever idea! She knew there were lots of other people who wanted to fly too, but couldn't because the flight was cancelled. So Renee asked them all to drive with them!
content.tw: 她知道其他人也因為班機取消不能飛，於是邀請他們一起坐車！

content.en: Lots of people wanted to go, so they had to rent a huge van! One big enough for 15 people!
content.tw: 因為很多人要一起，所以他們最後租了一個可以坐15個人的超大廂型車！

content.en: So this big group of total strangers all agreed to travel together, from Orlando to Knoxville. 650 miles… or about one thousand kilometers!
content.tw: 他們從奧蘭多開到諾克斯維爾，一共650英里，將近1000公里！

content.en: It took them 10 hours, and they had fun the whole way, talking and laughing and playing silly games! By the time they'd arrived they were all best friends.
content.tw: 這趟旅程花了十個鐘頭，一路上玩遊戲聊天，到達目的地時他們都成了好朋友！

content.en: Everyone had a great drive, made lots of new friends, and they all got to Knoxville on time! All thanks to Renee, and her very clever idea.
content.tw: 大家開車都很開心，交了很多新朋友，而且都準時到達諾克斯維爾！這一切都要歸功於 Renee 和她非常聰明的想法。

vocabulary.preface: 這批乘客原本要從空中飛，卻變成在地上搭車，也順利達到了目的地。

content.text:
1. cancel 取消
Oh, no! They canceled our flight! 糟糕，他們取消了我們的班機。
How could they do that? 他們怎麼可以那樣？
I can't believe it. 真不敢相信。
Now we won't make it to the final game. 現在我們趕不上決賽了。

2. game 比賽
But I want to see the final game! 可是我想看決賽！
I know. Let me ask if we can fly there early tomorrow.
我知道。我來問問能不能明天一早飛去。

3. agree 同意
Okay, they've agreed to let us fly tomorrow. 好了，他們同意讓我們明天飛。
Will we still be late for the game? 我們看比賽仍然會遲到嗎？

4. late 遲到
Better late than never. 遲到比永遠不到好。
I guess you're right. 我想你是對的。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些單字很簡單喔！
cancel 取消
game 比賽
agree 同意
late 遲到

quiz.question: 1. What kind of vehicle did the group rent?
2. How far is the journey from Orlando to Knoxville?
3. How long did the journey take?

content.en: We can use the power of water to make clean energy, without any smelly smoke or dirty pollution.
content.tw: 我們可以用水力製造乾淨的能源，還不會製造汙染跟濃煙！

content.en: That's why, high in the mountains of Switzerland, they've just built the world's biggest water battery!
content.tw: 現在瑞士在一座高山上，蓋了世界最大的水電池！

content.en: It's made of two huge lakes, one high above, and one down below. To make electricity, water moves super-fast from the high lake down to the low lake, through big long tunnels!
content.tw: 這個電池由兩座湖構成。水會從比較高的湖，通過隧道流到比較低的湖裡面，這樣就可以發電！

content.en: Inside the tunnels are huge turbines. They look like the blades of a fan, but much, much bigger!
content.tw: 隧道裡面有很大很大的渦輪，長得很像電風扇的葉片。

content.en: The power of the rushing water makes the turbines spin really fast. As the turbines spin, they make electricity!
content.tw: 水沖過渦輪，渦輪會開始高速轉動，就可以產生電力！

content.en: This water battery is so big it took 14 years to build, and it can make enough electricity to power 900,000 homes! That's more than they need in Switzerland, so they want to share it with the rest of Europe.
content.tw: 蓋這個水電池一共花了14年，生產的電力可以供應九十萬個家庭使用。因為自己用不完，瑞士打算跟其他國家分享！

content.en: Lots of clean energy for folks all over Europe, for years, all thanks to the world's biggest water battery!
content.tw: 歐洲各地的人們將會獲得多年的潔淨能源，這一切都歸功於這個世界上最大的水電池！

vocabulary.preface: 瑞士的水電池，是利用水位的高低差來發電。

content.text:
1. Switzerland 瑞士
Have you ever been to Switzerland? 你有沒有去過瑞士？
No, have you? 沒有，你去過嗎？
No, but I'd sure like to visit. 沒有，很想去看看。

2. lake 湖泊
They have lots of beautiful lakes and high mountains.
他們有很多漂亮的湖和高山。
Yeah, and lots of snow too. It must be very cold there.
對，還有很多雪。那裏一定很冷。

3. biggest 最大的
And Lake Geneva is the biggest high-mountain lake in Europe.
還有，日內瓦湖是歐洲最大的高山湖。
Bigger than Sun Moon Lake? 比日月潭大嗎？
Much bigger. 大多了。

4. clean 乾淨的
It uses clean energy too. 它也用乾淨能源。
It all sounds great. 聽起來都很不錯。
But I prefer a warm place. 可是我喜歡溫暖的地方。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天學到哪些單字？
Switzerland 瑞士
lake 湖泊
biggest 最大的
clean 乾淨的

quiz.question: 1. Where is the world's biggest water battery?
2. What's inside the water battery's big long tunnels?
3. How long did this water battery take to build?

content.en: Do you like to eat guava? It's a green fruit that grows on a tree. I'm eating some right now. Delicious! Guava is popular in Taiwan, but people in India also eat it.
content.tw: 你喜歡吃芭樂嗎？芭樂不只在台灣很有名，印度人也吃芭樂。

content.en: In fact, an Indian farmer named Kapil is thankful for Taiwanese guava. This fruit has made his farm successful.
content.tw: 有一位叫 Kapil 的印度農夫很感謝台灣的芭樂，因為芭樂讓他的農場大獲成功。

content.en: Kapil used to work at a big city bank. When COVID-19 came to India, Kapil lost his job. He had to go home to his family's village.
content.tw: Kapil 本來在銀行工作，但是在疫情時丟掉了工作，只好回到家鄉。

content.en: He could not find another job, so he decided to grow fruit. Some people said he couldn't grow fruit, because the weather was too dry. But Kapil wanted to try anyway.
content.tw: 他找不到工作，所以決定去種水果。有人說那裡的天氣太乾燥了，沒辦法種水果，但是他還是想試試看。

content.en: He found a company that sold baby guava trees from Taiwan. He learned this kind of fruit tree does not need much water, so it can grow in dry places. It was the perfect choice for Kapil.
content.tw: 他找到一間賣台灣芭樂樹苗的公司。他發現這種水果不需要很多水，很適合乾燥的地方。

content.en: He planted the baby trees and watched them grow. Finally, he harvested the guava. His fruit was super tasty! He sold the fruit and made good money.
content.tw: 他把樹苗種在土裡，看著它們長大。結果他收成的芭樂超級好吃！他賣掉芭樂，賺了很多錢。

content.en: These days, Kapil is a successful farmer. His guava fruit are popular in that part of India. He says Taiwan guavas changed his life.
content.tw: 如今，Kapil 是一位成功的農夫。他的芭樂在印度該地區很受歡迎。他說台灣芭樂改變了他的生活。

vocabulary.preface: 芭樂是一種美味又營養的水果，在印度也能生長。

content.text:
1. fruit 水果
I need some green plants in my room. 我房間裡需要一些綠色植物。
Have you tried fruit trees? 你有試過放果樹嗎？

2. grow 種植
No, are they easy to grow? 沒有，它們好種嗎？
Some of them are. 有些很好種。
They can grow well even in dry places. 就算在乾燥的地方也長得很好。

3. successful 成功的
We're in Taipei. It's usually wet. 我們在台北，經常很潮濕。
You're right. 你是對的。
Then you should be successful in growing them. 那你種果樹應該會成功。

4. try 嘗試
Hmmm, what should I grow? 種什麼好呢？
I suggest you try blueberries. 我建議你試試看藍莓。
Because you love them. 因為你喜歡藍莓。
Of course. 當然。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like eating fruit?
fruit 水果
grow 種植
successful 成功的
try 嘗試

quiz.question: 1. Where does Kapil live?
2. What caused Kapil to lose his bank job?
3. Why did Kapil choose to grow Taiwanese guava?

content.en: Ohhh… I hear an owl.
content.tw: 我聽到貓頭鷹的聲音。

content.en: Shhh… let's listen...
content.tw: 噓……我們來聽聽看...

content.en: Owls live in the forest, right?
content.tw: 貓頭鷹住在森林裡，對吧？

content.en: But did you know they can fly super far? Sometimes owls fly very far away from their home in the forest.
content.tw: 但你知道牠們可以飛得很遠嗎？有時候貓頭鷹會飛離牠們在森林裡的家很遠。

content.en: But, one owl in Scotland flew too far!
content.tw: 貓頭鷹住在森林裡面，牠們有時候還會飛得離家很遠。但有一隻蘇格蘭的貓頭鷹不小心飛太遠了！

content.en: This owl flew far, far out over the sea. The poor owl was being attacked by seagulls, so it landed on a fishing boat.
content.tw: 牠飛過大海，被海鷗攻擊，最後停在一艘漁船上。

content.en: The people on the fishing boat saw the owl and helped it. They took it inside the boat, gave it some meat, and found a warm place for it to rest.
content.tw: 漁夫把牠帶進船艙裡面，餵牠吃肉，還給牠溫暖的地方休息。

content.en: The owl quickly became friendly. It sat on the fishermen's arms and almost looked like a pet!
content.tw: 貓頭鷹很快變得很親近人，還會坐在漁民的手臂上，像寵物一樣！

content.en: The fishing boat finally took the owl back to Scotland, and now it is back flying and hunting in the forest.
content.tw: 這艘船後來把貓頭鷹帶回蘇格蘭，現在牠又回到森林裡面打獵了。

content.en: Owls fly far sometimes, but maybe this owl got caught in some strong wind and couldn't fly home.
content.tw: 貓頭鷹有時候飛得很遠，但這隻貓頭鷹可能被強風吹到，回不了家。

content.en: Wow. This owl was pretty lucky! It got away from the seagulls and found a boat. Now it's back in the forest in Scotland!
content.tw: 哇。這隻貓頭鷹真是太幸運了！牠從海鷗那裡逃脫並找到了一艘船。現在牠又回到了蘇格蘭的森林裡！

vocabulary.preface: 一隻離家太遠的貓頭鷹，被漁民搭救，撿回一條命。

content.text:
1. fish 釣魚
I'm going fishing with Tom tomorrow night. 我明天晚上跟湯姆去釣魚。
Fishing at night? 晚上釣魚？
Yeah, Tom will take his boat out, and we'll hunt for squid.

2. boat 船
So you'll be on his boat? 所以你要搭他的船？
Right. Why do you sound so alarmed? 對，為什麼你聽起來那麼緊張？
Didn't you know that he has a boat? 你不知道他有船？

3. fisherman 漁夫
No. And I didn't know you're a fisherman. 不知道。而且我也不知道你是漁夫。
I'm not. 我不是。
And you'll be far away from land. 而且你會距離陸地很遠。

4. far away 很遠
Not that far away. Only around Badouzi. 沒有那麼遠，就在八斗子附近。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡釣魚嗎？
fish 釣魚
boat 船
fisherman 漁夫
far away 很遠

quiz.question: 1. Where does this owl live?
2. What happened to the owl in this story?
3. Who saved the owl?

content.en: We get most of our heat and light from electricity. The problem is, electricity can be expensive!
content.tw: 我們的熱能以及光都是靠電力。但是電費很貴喔！

content.en: Thousands of years ago, in England, owning an oven was expensive too. Most people didn't have one in their home.
content.tw: 好幾千年以前，大多數的英國人家裡沒有窯，因為窯太貴了。

content.en: Instead of lots of little ovens, most villages had just one that was really big. They called it the 'village oven'. The baker would use it first. Then, while the oven was still warm, everyone else could use it too!
content.tw: 當時村莊裡面會有一座共用的窯。烘焙師傅先用，他烤完之後，其他的村民也趁熱去使用。

content.en: Last year, a baker in England decided to bring the village oven back! He wanted to help people pay their electric bills, so he opened up his huge kitchen for everyone to use, and even offered to cook some things for free!
content.tw: 去年有一個英國的烘焙師傅，他想幫大家省電費，所以恢復了這個傳統。他讓大家用他的廚房，還免費烤東西給大家吃！

content.en: They call him Baker Ed. He's helped people in his town lots of times before. He's held free cookery classes and free kid's clubs. And when it's cold he lets people use the heat of his oven to keep warm!
content.tw: 大家叫他 Ed 師傅。他以前也常常幫助他的村莊。他會開免費的烘焙課，還有小孩的社團！很冷的時候，他也會讓大家在他的烤箱旁邊取暖！

content.en: His neighbors and friends think he is doing an amazing thing, helping people to eat and keep warm while electricity is so expensive. Bravo Baker Ed!
content.tw: 他的鄰居和朋友們都認為他正在做一件很棒的事情，在電費如此昂貴的時候，幫助人們溫飽。艾德師傅，好樣的！

vocabulary.preface: 英國的麵包師傅，把自己的大烤箱開放給他人使用，暖胃又暖心。

content.text:
1. cook 烹飪.
It's so cold here! 這裡好冷喔!
You have to cook something, Paz! Anything.

2. oven 烤箱.
Okay, let me bake some cookies and bread in the oven.
Great idea! 好主意!
Let's fire up the oven now.

3. kitchen 廚房.
Not so fast.不要這麼快。
I need to prepare the stuff first. 我需要先準備材料。
Would you like to help me in the kitchen? 你可以來廚房幫我嗎?
I'd be happy to. 我很樂意。

4. warm 溫暖的.
Finally, I'm feeling warm! 我終於覺得暖和了。
Can you smell that? It's our bread baking. 你聞得出來嗎?我們的麵包正在烤。
I love warm bread! 我愛熱麵包!

vocabulary.postscript:
記得多多使用這些單字!
cook烹飪
oven烤箱
kitchen廚房
warm溫暖的

quiz.question: 1. What can fire not do?
2. Where did they use village ovens thousands of years ago?
3. What do they call the kind baker in this story?

content.en: Today is Public Radio Broadcasting Day.
content.tw: 今天是世界無線電日！

content.en: The radio has many programs: music, news, and education.
content.tw: 收音機會播放音樂、新聞，還有教育節目。

content.en: So, let's talk about some radio programs which do an important job in Afghanistan.
content.tw: 我們來聊聊阿富汗的廣播節目！

content.en: Afghanistan is a big country in Asia. Recently, that country got a new law. The law says girls can't go to school.
content.tw: 最近，阿富汗的新法律規定女孩不能上學。

content.en: Girls want to change this law, but for now they must stay home. If they can't go to school, how can they keep learning?
content.tw: 女孩子們想推翻這項法律，但是現在她們必須待在家裡，但如果不去上學，要怎麼學習呢？

content.en: The answer is radio. Some radio stations in Afghanistan now give lessons every day. Students can listen to the radio at home to learn math, science and other subjects.
content.tw: 答案是收音機廣播！有一些阿富汗的電台開始每天開課，只要打開收音機就可以學數學、科學等等的科目。

content.en: Sometimes they read books out loud, to teach reading skills. Girls can even call in to the stations to talk about their problems.
content.tw: 有時候會在節目中讀課文，教大家閱讀。這些女孩子們還可以打電話到電台問問題。

content.en: The women who run the stations say the future of girls is the future of Afghanistan.
content.tw: 管理電台的女士們說，想要給女孩子們一個機會，因為她們的未來就是阿富汗的未來。

content.en: Today, on Public Radio Broadcasting Day, let's remember that radio can make a difference.
content.tw: 今天，在世界廣播日，讓我們記住廣播可以帶來改變。

vocabulary.preface: 阿富汗的女子不准上學，還好有一些收音機教學節目，讓她們繼續學習。

content.text:
1. school 學校
Aren't you going to school today? 你今天不去上學？
No, I'm staying at home. 對，我待在家。

2. math 數學
What about your math lessons? 那你的數學課怎麼辦？
I can learn math myself. 我可以自己學數學。
How? By listening to yourself talk? 怎麼學? 你就自言自語嗎？
No, I listen to the radio. 不，我會聽收音機。

3. program 節目
There's no way you can learn math through radio programs!
你不可能從廣播節目學數學。
Are you kidding? Of course I can. 開玩笑，當然可以。

4. learn 學習
I think it's a bad idea to miss school. 我覺得錯過上學很糟糕。
Don't worry. I can learn anywhere, anytime. 別擔心，我不論何時何地都可以學習。

vocabulary.postscript:
Let's read today's vocabulary.
school 學校
math 數學
program 節目
learn 學習

quiz.question: 1. What country does not let girls go to school?
2. What do these radio stations want to give girls?
3. What day is today?

content.en: Have you ever seen a statue? It can be made of stone, or metal, or all kinds of things!
content.tw: 你看過雕像嗎？你可以用各種材料製作雕像。

content.en: Yesterday, In Boston, Massachusetts, they got a brand new very special statue. It's 20 feet tall and 40 feet wide. And it's made of a beautiful shiny metal called bronze.
content.tw: 昨天，有一座新雕像在波士頓落成了。這座雕像是用青銅做的，高 20 呎，寬 40 呎！

content.en: It was made for a famous person from history, called Martin Luther King Jr. In fact, today is Martin Luther King Jr. Day! He believed it was wrong to treat someone differently because of how they looked, or what they believed, or where they came from.
content.tw: 這座雕像為了紀念馬丁路德金恩博士而製作。其實，今天正好是馬丁路德金恩日！金恩博士認為人們因為外表、信仰，或是生長地而遭到歧視，是錯誤的。

content.en: Lots of people agreed with King. One time, 250,000 people marched with him all the way to Washington D.C., the USA's capital city. There, he gave a very famous speech, called "I Have a Dream".
content.tw: 很多人贊同金恩博士的看法。有一次在美國首都華府，總共有25萬人跟他一起遊行。當天金恩博士發表了知名的演說，叫做「我有一個夢」。

content.en: The next year, King was given the "Nobel Peace Prize" for helping so many people. 60 years later, people still celebrate him!
content.tw: 隔年，金恩博士獲得了諾貝爾和平獎，因為他幫助了許多人。60年後，人們仍在紀念他！

vocabulary.preface: 波士頓有一座新的銅像，紀念美國民權運動的領袖金恩博士。

content.text:
1. famous 著名的
Michelangelo's David is the most famous statue in the world.
米蓋朗基羅的大衛像是全世界最有名的雕像。
Really? I thought it's the Statue of Liberty. 真的嗎？我以為是自由女神像。

2. metal 金屬
They are different. 它們不一樣。
David is made of stone. 大衛像是石頭做的。
And the Statue of Liberty? 自由女神像呢？
It's made of metal. 它是金屬做的。

3. agree 同意
I think David is more beautiful. 我覺得大衛像比較美。
I agree. 我同意。
It looks very much like a real man. 它看起來很像真人。

4. history 歷史
And it has a long history of 500 years. 而且它有五百年的歷史了。
A 500-year-old man? Still very handsome. 五百歲的人？還是很帥呢！

vocabulary.postscript:
我們來讀讀單字。
famous 著名的
metal 金屬
agree 同意
history 歷史

quiz.question: 1. Where is Martin Luther King Jr.'s new statue?
2. How big is the new statue?
3. How many people marched with King to Washington DC?

title: Young People Share Huge Bucket of Popcorn

content.en: I love eating popcorn! It's so delicious when I add some salt and butter.
content.tw: 我喜歡吃爆米花！加一點鹽跟奶油，真是美味。

content.en: I always eat popcorn at the movies.
content.tw: 我總是在看電影的時候吃爆米花。

content.en: When my family goes to the movie theater, we get a big bowl of popcorn to share together.
content.tw: 我們全家去電影院的時候，總會買一大桶的爆米花來分享。

content.en: In fact, did you hear what happened recently in Kaohsiung?
content.tw: 你有聽到最近在高雄發生的事嗎？

content.en: Some young people went to a new movie theater. There, they filled a huge bucket with popcorn. 1600 liters of popcorn! That bucket is so big, you could swim in it.
content.tw: 幾個年輕人去一家新開張的電影院，用爆米花裝滿了一個1600 公升的水桶。那個水桶大到可以在裡面游泳。

content.en: How could they get so much popcorn? Since the movie theater was new, they had a special deal. The theater would fill any bowl with popcorn for only 50 NT dollars, no matter how big.
content.tw: 他們怎麼能弄到這麼多爆米花呢？因為電影院有開幕特價，只要50元，觀眾拿來的碗不管多大都可以裝滿爆米花。

content.en: The theater did not expect anyone to bring a 1600 liter bucket. But they filled it anyway. The bucket was so huge, they needed a truck to carry it away.
content.tw: 電影院沒想到有人會帶1600公升的水桶來，不過還是把它裝滿了，年輕人必須用卡車才能把爆米花運走。

content.en: Did the young people eat all the popcorn? Actually, they shared it with the people of Kaohsiung. They handed out the popcorn to homeless people on the street.
content.tw: 最後，年輕人把爆米花分發給街上無家可歸的人。

content.en: Those young people took the chance to help others. As a result, lots of people shared the tasty popcorn!
content.tw: 這些年輕人把握機會幫助他人。結果，許多人分享了美味的爆米花！

vocabulary.preface: 一群年輕人拿到超大桶的爆米花，讓街上遊民共享。

content.text:
1. salt 鹽
Let me get the tickets. 我去買票。
And I will get popcorn and drinks. 我去買爆米花跟飲料。
A bucket of popcorn for you, right? 你要一桶爆米花對吧？
Right, with salt and butter. 對，要加鹽跟奶油。

2. huge 巨大的
Wow, this is a huge bucket! 哇，好大一桶！
I know. Are you sure you're not eating too much popcorn?
我知道。你確定你不會吃太多爆米花嗎？

3. share 分享
Not if you're sharing it with me. 假如你跟我一起吃就不會。
That's the response I'm waiting for. 我就在等妳這句話。

4. tasty 好吃的
Hmmm, this is really tasty! 這真的很好吃呢！
Now who's eating too much popcorn? 現在是誰吃太多爆米花？

vocabulary.postscript:
一起來讀讀看。
salt 鹽
huge 巨大的
share 分享
tasty 好吃的

quiz.question: 1. How much popcorn did the young people get?
2. How did they carry the popcorn bucket away?
3. Who did the young people give the popcorn to?

title: A Goal to Protect 30% of Earth

content.en: Do you have a goal? Most people have goals in life. That means they know what they want.
content.tw: 你有目標嗎？大部分的人都會有一些人生的目標。這意味著他們對自己想要的東西有想法。

content.en: The best goal is a clear goal. If you know exactly what you want, it is easier to get.
content.tw: 最好的目標就是清楚地知道你想要什麼，就更容易得到。

content.en: Recently, all the countries in the world had a big meeting called COP15 ("cop fifteen"). Their goal was to solve a problem.
content.tw: 一百多個國家的代表最近聚集在一起，參加 COP15聯合國生物多樣性大會。他們的目標是解決一個問題。

content.en: Every year, more kinds of plants and animals are lost forever. It is one of Earth's biggest problems. We need to act soon.
content.tw: 每一年都有更多種類的植物跟動物永遠消失。這是地球上最大的問題之一。我們需要盡快採取行動。

content.en: To deal with this problem, the countries set a clearer goal. They call it "Thirty by Thirty". That means they want to protect 30% of Earth's nature by the year 2030.
content.tw: 為了解決這個問題，各國設定更清楚的目標。他們稱之為「三十乘三十」。意思是他們希望2030年之前保護地球30%的自然環境。

content.en: That sounds like something we can really do! Now we only have a few years to reach the goal, so all the countries on Earth must work together.
content.tw: 這聽起來是我們真的可以做的事情！現在我們只有幾年的時間來實現這個目標，所以地球上的所有國家都必須共同努力。

content.en: They have a clear goal... do you have one?
content.tw: 他們有一個明確的目標……你有一個嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 保護動植物，也是愛護地球的方法。

content.text: 1. life 人生。Do you know what you want in life? 你知道你的人生想要什麼嗎？Yes, very clearly. 知道，很清楚。
2. want 想要。I want to always eat good food, live in a nice house and have lots of clothes. 我想要總是吃美食，住好房子，有很多衣服。You're right. 你說對了。You do know what you want. 你確實知道想要什麼。
3. easier 比較容易的。How about you? 你呢？Well, I'd like to have an easier job. 我想要有個比較輕鬆的工作。That sounds like a good idea. 聽起來是個好主意。
4. together 一起。But what kind of job? 但是哪種工作呢？A job like watching TV together with my family. 比如說家人一起看電視。What?! 什麼啊？！You can't make money that way! 這樣賺不到錢！

vocabulary.postscript: 你的人生想做什麼呢？life 人生 want 想要 easier 比較容易的 together 一起

quiz.question: 1. What kind of goal is best?
2. What did the countries in COP15 want to protect?
3. How much of Earth did they set a goal to protect?

content.en: Happy New Year everyone! Next week will be the start of the Year of the Rabbit!
content.tw: 新年快樂！下星期就是兔年的開始。

content.en: Last year was the Year of the Tiger. Tigers are big, strong and brave! Rabbits are small, cute and fluffy!
content.tw: 老虎高大強壯而勇敢，兔子則嬌小可愛，還毛茸茸的。

content.en: In old Chinese stories, the tiger was the king of all the animals! So, in the Year of the Tiger, people are really brave! They make big choices in their lives. Their choices don't always go super well, but a tiger is never afraid to try!
content.tw: 中國傳統故事裡，老虎是百獸之王。所以大家在虎年的時候會很勇敢地做出重大的選擇，不見得是最好的，但是老虎不怕嘗試。

content.en: Just like in real life, the rabbit in those stories was very different from the tiger. It was the gentlest, most thoughtful animal. So, in the Year of the Rabbit, people like to help each other.
content.tw: 跟現實生活一樣，那些故事中的兔子跟老虎大不相同。兔子是最溫和、最體貼的動物。所以，在兔年，人們喜歡互相幫助。

content.en: The rabbit's gentle nature calms the tiger's crazy ups and downs!
content.tw: 兔子溫柔的天性平息了老虎瘋狂的起伏！

content.en: Even though rabbits are kind and gentle, they are also fast and clever! So this year should be lucky for everyone!
content.tw: 雖然兔子生性和善，但牠們動作可快了，並且很聰明，這就是為什麼兔子是最幸運的動物！因此，今年對每一個人來說應該是幸運的一年！

content.en: We'll all be lucky in our lives: at school, at work, and with our friends and family… So, let's all say goodbye to the roaring tiger, and hello to the lucky rabbit! See you next year!
content.tw: 我們在學校、工作、與朋友和家人相處都會很幸運…所以，讓我們告別咆哮的老虎，迎接幸運的兔子！明年見！

vocabulary.preface: 我們即將邁入兔年，這跟虎年應該大不一樣。

content.text:
1. cute 可愛的
The Year of the Rabbit is about to start. 兔年就要開始了。
Yeah, I love rabbits! 我喜歡兔子！
Why? 為什麼？
Because they're cute and gentle. 因為牠們很可愛又很溫和。

2. fast 快速的
And they don't need to work hard. 而且還不用努力工作。
But if a tiger comes after them, they have to run hard!
但是假如有老虎來追牠們，就得拼命跑。
That's okay. They're fast runners. 那又沒關係，牠們跑很快。

3. crazy 瘋狂的
I'm thinking of keeping two rabbits. 我在想養兩隻兔子。
At home? You're crazy! 養在家裡嗎？你瘋了！

4. animal 動物
You're too busy to care for the animals. 你那麼忙，沒辦法照顧動物的。
I'll take them to work. 我會帶牠們上班。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些都是很常用到的英文字。
cute 可愛的
fast 快速的
crazy 瘋狂的
animal 動物
